intro: Wenchengia alternifolia, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant has alternate leaves that are typically lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
